text: Lithocarpus formosanus is a species of tree in the family Fagaceae. L. formosanus is a medium-sized tree with crooked trunk and many branches. It is endemic to Taiwan as it only occurs in the Hengchun Peninsula in the extreme south of the country. It grows in mixed mesophytic forests at altitudes of . Only single population of fewer than 50 individuals survives. Lithocarpus formosanus is similar to L. dodonaeifolius, and their identity as separate species has been questioned. Molecular methods suggest that they are closely related but distinct species. ==References== formosanus Category:Endemic flora of Taiwan Category:Trees of Taiwan Category:Critically endangered flora of Asia Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Lithocarpus formosanus
